title: Property Tax Relief, State Education Improvements and Affordable Healthcare | Lawmakers 2026
summary:
Here is a structured markdown summary of the Georgia legislative session based on the transcript provided:

# Georgia Property Tax Relief, State Education Improvements and Affordable Healthcare | Lawmakers 2026 Session

## Overview
The transcript highlights the key priorities for the Georgia legislature in the 2026 session, including property tax relief, education improvements focused on childhood literacy, and efforts to address the rising costs of healthcare and health insurance.

## Key Actions
No specific bills were mentioned in the transcript.

## Bills Introduced (First Reading)
No bills were mentioned as being introduced.

## Notable Moments
- The House Majority Leader and House Minority Whip discussed the legislative priorities of their respective caucuses.
- There was a focus on property tax relief, with the Republican caucus proposing the elimination of the homestead property tax statewide.
- Education was a major priority, with a focus on improving childhood literacy and addressing issues like student loan debt.
- The Democratic caucus pushed for Medicaid expansion, while the Republican caucus emphasized affordability and accessibility in healthcare, including efforts to grow the healthcare workforce.

## Votes
No specific votes were mentioned in the transcript.

## Adjournment
The transcript does not mention when the session adjourned or the date of the next session.
